business.headline: Compliance norms for edible oil industry tightened, nationwide inspections plannedStakeholders have been urged to complete registration and begin monthly reporting without delay to support a robust, data driven edible oil supply chain.

Criminal angle in Kalyani family feud as police begin inquiry into property fraudIndustrialist Gaurishankar Kalyani and his wife are to be summoned by police for an inquiry into the illegal transfer of ancestral properties by cheating and duping sister Sugandha Hiremath.

Samvat 2082: Top stocks and sectors to bet on for the new yearIndia's macroeconomic fundamentals remain firm. Global rating agency S&P recently upgraded India's credit outlook, while the International Monetary Fund (IMF) raised its GDP forecast.

Curious case of RRP Semiconductor: The stock that gained 63,000% in 18 monthsRRP Semiconductor's stock soared from Rs 15 to Rs 9,478 in just 18 months, stunning Dalal Street. But do the company's financials really justify this meteoric rise?

Waaree Energies shares jump 50% in a year: More upside left in the stock?The company's Q2 FY26 results were strong across all key metrics. Waaree Energies reported a 132.97% year-on-year jump in consolidated net profit to Rs 871.21 crore in the September 2025 quarter, compared to Rs 375.66 crore a year ago.

Will gold, silver prices fall in India tomorrow as global rates crash?Global gold and silver have cooled after historic gains, while MCX remains closed. Will Indian investors face similar declines tomorrow, or is this a buying opportunity? Read on to find out.

US likely to cut tariffs on Indian imports to 15%-16%: ReportThe proposed agreement mainly focusses on the energy and agriculture sectors. One of the key elements under discussion is India's gradual reduction of crude oil imports from Russia, a move that aligns with Washington's efforts to limit global dependence on Russian energy supplies.

Samvat 2082: 15 high-conviction stock ideas amid ongoing market rallyAnalysts see higher returns ahead as Dalal Street enters Samvat 2082. Check out Choice Broking's top 15 stock picks span defence, tech, and premium consumption.

BSE, NSE holiday: Is stock market open or closed for trading today?The stock market was closed on Tuesday on account of Diwali and only two more holidays remain this year. One for Guru Nanank Jayanti on November 05 and the other for Christmas, December 25.

Gold, silver prices fall: Is the bullion rally ending?Gold prices have gained nearly 56% this year due to strong demand from central banks, ongoing geopolitical tensions, and rising expectations of rate cuts by major central banks.

Muhurat Trading ends in green; Cipla, Bajaj Finserv among top gainersThe BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty50 both closed in the green, led by gains in Cipla and Bajaj Finserv, even as mid-session profit booking trimmed early advances.

Samvat 2082: Experts see new highs, bet on domestic sectorsFor investors, Bandyopadhyay recommends focusing on domestic growth stories. "Cement, infrastructure, construction, and capital goods will lead the charge," he noted, highlighting Ultratech Cement, L&T, and Bharti Airtel as top picks.

Muhurat Trading 2025: Sensex, Nifty dip after strong opening; Infosys up 1%The BSE Sensex rose 180.76 points, or 0.21%, to 84,544.13, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 62.60 points, or 0.24%, to 25,905.75 at 1:50 pm.
How to make the most of your Diwali bonus and build long-term wealthTurn your Diwali bonus into a stepping stone for long-term financial security with these expert-backed tips.

Gold hits Rs 1.30 lakh again, silver at Rs 1.58 lakh: Buy now or wait for a dip?Gold and silver are regaining momentum amid festive demand and global uncertainty. Investors should buy with discipline, stagger purchases, and treat bullion as a long-term hedge rather than chasing short-term spikes.

Muhurat Trading today: Your quick guide to today's one-hour special sessionAs Muhurat Trading 2025 begins this afternoon, optimism runs high on Dalal Street. With Nifty near record highs and liquidity improving, experts suggest discipline, stock selection, and long-term focus.

Sensex, Nifty end higher on Diwali as Reliance, bank stocks shineThe BSE Sensex rose 0.5% to 84,363.37, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 0.49% to 25,851—both hitting fresh one-year highs. Over the past four sessions, the indices have climbed 2.8%, leaving them less than 2% away from their all-time highs scaled in September 2024.

China files WTO complaint against India over EV subsidies and batteriesThe Chinese Commerce Ministry has alleged that the measures by India violate several WTO obligations, including the principle of national treatment, and constitute import substitution subsidies, which are explicitly prohibited under the multi-lateral trade rules.

Muhurat Trading on October 21: Check timing, trade strategy and moreMuhurat Trading will take place on October 21 this year. The pre-open session will run from 1:30 pm to 1:45 pm, followed by the main trading window from 1:45 pm to 2:45 pm, and a closing session until 3:05 pm.

Reliance shares jump 3% after Q2 results. Should it be in your Diwali portfolio?Around 10:20 am, shares of Reliance Industries rose 3.22% to Rs 1,462.60 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The stock's sharp upmove added to the broader market rally on Dalal Street as sentiment turned upbeat following a string of solid earnings reports.

entertainment.headline: Happy birthday Prabhas: Rebel Star who redefined pan-India superstardom From 'Baahubali' to 'The Raja Saab', Prabhas has never played it safe. As he turns 45, we look at how the Telugu superstar continues to reinvent himself, trusting new filmmakers, exploring new genres, and quietly redefining what it means to be a Pan-India hero.

Kim Kardashian celebrates 45th birthday in Paris with cast of legal drama All's Fair Kim Kardashian marked her 45th birthday in Paris alongside her All's Fair co-stars, enjoying an extravagant party, couture fashion moments, and family surprises.

Charlie Puth says I hope baby likes music, as he embraces fatherhood Singer Charlie Puth revealed he and wife Brooke Sansone are expecting their first child in March.  The announcement was made on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon and reflected in the 'Changes' music video.

TWICE dominates Billboard as KPop Demon Hunters craze takes over K-pop girl group Twice celebrates a decade with record-breaking Billboard chart placements.  New albums and singles secure high positions on major US charts.
Jimmy Kimmel quips ABC made a mistake choosing him over Jon Stewart Jimmy Kimmel says ABC nearly gave his talk show to Jon Stewart. The host reflects on ratings, controversies, and network decisions.

Miley Cyrus calls Avatar: Fire and Ash deeply personal, announces new song Singer Miley Cyrus unveils an original song for 'Avatar: Fire and Ash', co-written with Mark Ronson and Andrew Wyatt. The song and film resonate with Cyrus's personal experience of loss and rebuilding after the Malibu wildfire.

BB19 Episode 60: Farhana-Neelam's kitchen clash, Kunicka's breakdown to nominations 'Bigg Boss 19' house descended into chaos with heated arguments over chores and relationships. The new nomination twist adds complexity to already strained dynamics.

Emily in Paris 5 teaser: Lily Collins explores new romance, adventures in Rome 'Emily in Paris' returns for season 5 with Emily exploring a new romance in Italy. The upcoming season featuring Lily Collins in the titular role, promises scenic adventures and fresh characters, stirring excitement among fans.

Influencer Apoorva Mukhija slams commercialisation of content creation, to retire Apoorva Mukhija opens up about the commercialisation of social media and her fatigue from content creation. She hints at retiring soon while staying open to new opportunities.

Priyanka Chopra shares heartfelt birthday wish for new mother Parineeti Chopra Actor Priyanka Chopra shared an emotional collage on Parineeti Chopra's 37th birthday. The post celebrates Parineeti's new journey into motherhood and the joy it brings.

Ella McCay trailer: Emma Mackey as Governor handles politics, complex family issues James L Brooks unveiled the trailer for his new film Ella McCay starring Emma Mackey. The movie explores family and work-life challenges with humour and emotion, promising a heartfelt cinematic experience.

Shiva Rajkumar set to play ex-MLA Gummadi Narsaiah in Telugu debut as lead Kannada actor Shiva Rajkumar is set to play the titular role in the pan-Indian project, 'Gummadi Narasaiah', a biopic on the life of the five-time MLA of united Andhra Pradesh.

India's Oscar entry Homebound, Songs of Forgotten Trees to premiere at Dharamshala The 14th Dharamshala International Film Festival will be held from October 30 to November 2 in Upper Dharamshala. The event highlights award-winning films and masterclasses, boosting India's indie cinema scene.

Smriti Irani calls Bill Gates's Kyunki... cameo a historic milestone Actor Smriti Irani described Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates's appearance on 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi 2' as historic. Gates will appear via video call and offer advice to Tulsi, played by Irani.

Lee Yi-kyung faces reputation damage over AI-fabricated allegations: Full timeline Actor Lee Yi-kyung faced reputation damage over AI-fabricated allegations. His agency denied the claims and announced legal action.

Javed Akhtar-Lucky Ali controversy explained: Why an old video is sparking new outrage Lyricist Javed Akhtar's old interview on religion has resurfaced, sparking backlash from singer Lucky Ali, who called his remarks "ugly" and "monstrous." But what did Akhtar really say, and in what context? Here's a closer look at the controversy, beyond the viral clip.

Hrithik Roshan wishes mother Pinkie on her birthday with Benjamin Button reference Hrithik Roshan shared a heartfelt birthday post for his mother Pinkie Roshan, calling her the woman with the "most beautiful eyes in the world" and his "Benjamin Button mom."

Prabhas-Hanu film title to be revealed on actor's birthday, confirm makers As fans gear up for Prabhas' birthday celebrations, the makers of his upcoming collaboration with Hanu Raghavapudi have teased a big reveal — the title poster of their much-awaited project.

After Good Bad Ugly, Ilaiyaraaja takes legal action against Pradeep Ranganathan's Dude Composer Ilaiyaraaja has moved the Madras High Court alleging copyright infringement over the use of his songs in Pradeep Ranganathan's Tamil film 'Dude'.

general news.headline: Mahagathbandhan reaches consensus to project Tejashwi Yadav as CM face: SourcesAccording to RJD sources, all constituents of the Mahagathbandhan have agreed to endorse Tejashwi Yadav's leadership, and a formal announcement is expected later today.

PM Modi said India will cut Russian oil imports to nothing, claims TrumpThe US President praised India's cooperation as a big thing, noting that nearly 40 per cent of India's crude imports currently come from Russia.

US sanctions 2 Russian oil companies after Moscow holds nuclear drillsThe new sanctions, announced by the US Department of the Treasury's Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC), target both companies and several of their subsidiaries.

US should correct its mistake: Chinese diplomat's fresh warning amid trade warDonald Trump announced last week that the US will impose 100 per cent tariffs on Chinese imports over and above the tariffs that they are already paying.

I am a doctor and here's what I know about sudden deaths from silent heart killersAortic aneurysms and dissections are silent killers often mistaken for heart attacks. Early screening and awareness can prevent sudden deaths in India.

2nd ODI Live: Toss time in Adelaide, will India play Kuldeep?India (IND) vs Australia (AUS), 2nd ODI Live Score: The Indian cricket team will be looking to make a strong turnaround in the 2nd ODI match in Adelaide. After being drubbed by 7 wickets in Perth, the Shubman Gill-led side will hope to make a statement and push the series into a decider.

Epstein survivor Virginia Giuffre memoir claims rape by 'well-known Prime Minister'Virginia Giuffre's posthumous memoir accuses a well-known Prime Minister of brutal sexual abuse. The revelations deepen the controversy around Epstein's trafficking network and implicate high-profile figures.

Video: 3 killed as US strikes another suspected drug vessel, this time in PacificThe latest operation marks the first known Pacific strike under President Donald Trump's renewed anti-narcotics campaign, which has so far focused on the Caribbean with seven previous lethal attacks.

From Golconda to Louvre: Journey of the 'cursed' diamond left behind in the heistFrom a mine in southern India to the crown of France, the Regent Diamond's story spans empires, betrayals, and revolutions. Once hidden in a wound, smuggled in a shoe, and set in the sword of Napoleon, the gem remains a reminder of how power and desire have long been shaped by the glitter of a single stone.

Woman slams Taj Delhi restaurant for asking her to not sit cross-legged, posts videoIn a now-viral video, Shradha Sharma claimed that a hotel manager approached her during the meal and told her not to sit cross-legged as it was making other guests uncomfortable.
3 men barge into home, gang-rape woman in BengaluruThree drunk men barged into a woman's house, took her into another room, and then allegedly raped her.

PM to skip ASEAN summit in Malaysia, Jaishankar may represent India: ReportPrime Minister Narendra Modi is unlikely to attend the ASEAN summit in Malaysia due to scheduling conflicts. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will represent India, while Modi may join virtually, impacting planned diplomatic visits.

The viral '6-7' craze explained: How a TikTok joke turned into a school nuisanceA viral TikTok sound — "6-7" — has become a global playground chant. Schools are banning the phrase in various countries as classroom disruptions rise. Here's where it came from and why it spreads so fast.

Droupadi Murmu makes history as first woman President to pray at SabarimalaDroupadi Murmu is only the second President of India to visit the Lord Ayyappa temple in Sabarimala. The Sabarimala visit is a key part of President Murmu's four-day official tour of Kerala.

Pierre Poilievre's Diwali wish lights up controversy over Khalistani panderingCanadian Conservative leader Pierre Poilievre's Diwali greeting, meant to celebrate both Bandi Chhor Divas and Diwali, was immediately pounced upon by critics who claimed Poilievre's phrasing blurred religious lines and echoed separatist talking points.

Can Virat Kohli rekindle the magic in one last dance at Adelaide Oval?Australia vs India, 2nd ODI: Adelaide has celebrated Kohli's triumphs, but the story isn't over. One last innings at his beloved Oval could be the statement that confirms the hunger still burns, with the 2027 World Cup the prize he's aiming to conquer.

Why tattoos are the new travel souvenirsPeople are now travelling across the world just to get inked; after all, a tattoo made far from home is a reminder that you belong wherever your story takes you.

Earth has a new moon: Scientists have named it Arjuna 2025 PN7Scientists explain that quasi-moons like PN7 share the same orbital period as Earth, circling the Sun in roughly one year, but with slightly different paths.

Will BCCI push for Mohsin Naqvi to be impeached as ACC chairman?The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) reportedly have majority support but are unlikely to push for the impeachment of Asian Cricket Council (ACC) chief Mohsin Naqvi, aiming to avoid further tensions with Pakistan ahead of India hosting the T20 World Cup in 2026.

Can Harmanpreet Kaur help India break the SENA jinx in New Zealand clash?India haven't won a Women's World Cup match against a SENA nation since Harmanpreet Kaur's iconic 171 against Australia. They'll have a chance to end that streak when they face New Zealand in Navi Mumbai on Thursday.

Happy birthday Prabhas: Rebel Star who redefined pan-India superstardomFrom 'Baahubali' to 'The Raja Saab', Prabhas has never played it safe. As he turns 45, we look at how the Telugu superstar continues to reinvent himself, trusting new filmmakers, exploring new genres, and quietly redefining what it means to be a Pan-India hero.

Why Bengaluru's problem lies in misplaced pride and prioritiesThat Biocon founder Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw had to profess her love for Kannada after slamming Bengaluru's civic mess shows what truly ails Karnataka. With Kannada pride becoming the fulcrum of populist politics, Karnataka's politicians have made Bengaluru's potholes their very own while casting away the corporates who helped them build the state and the city.

Man who accused ex-Punjab DGP for son's murder known for varied political loyaltiesComplainant Shamsuddin Chaudhary, a cattle-feed trader who claims to be a neighbour of the Aqil Akhter's family, was previously associated with the AAP MLA from Malerkotla.

Author Michael Wolff sues Melania Trump after defamation threat over Epstein linkMichael Wolff, known for his bestselling books on President Donald Trump, said the threat came after his remarks to The Daily Beast and comments made in three social media videos. The First Lady's lawyer had set an October 15 deadline for the author to apologise, retract, and pay damages, which he refused.

sports.headline: UCL: Liverpool and Chelsea relish goal-fest, Real Madrid edge Juventus Liverpool and Chelsea returned to winning ways with emphatic 5-1 victories, while Real Madrid continued their perfect Champions League run with a narrow 1-0 win over Juventus.

Women's World Cup: Harleen, Pratika, and India coach's confusing lack of clarity India women's cricket team head coach Amol Muzumdar has dismissed strike rotation concerns ahead of the upcoming fixture against New Zealand in the Women's World Cup 2025. Muzumdar was seen contradicting his viewpoint from earlier in the tournament.

2nd ODI Live: Rohit, Kohli in focus as India hunt strong comeback in Adelaide India (IND) vs Australia (AUS), 2nd ODI Live Score: The Indian cricket team will be looking to make a strong turnaround in the 2nd ODI match in Adelaide. After being drubbed by 7 wickets in Perth, the Shubman Gill-led side will hope to make a statement and push the series into a decider.

Can Harmanpreet Kaur help India break the SENA jinx in New Zealand clash? India haven't won a Women's World Cup match against a SENA nation since Harmanpreet Kaur's iconic 171 against Australia. They'll have a chance to end that streak when they face New Zealand in Navi Mumbai on Thursday.

McGrath applauds world-class Sutherland, Gardner's rescue act against England Stand-in captain Tahlia McGrath lauds Sutherland and Gardner's world-class batting in a six-wicket win over England. Their unbeaten 180-run partnership showcased Australia's resilience and depth in the Women's World Cup.

Ashwin explains how Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli can rediscover ODI form Australia vs India: Former India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin reckons that Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli need support, space, open communication, and the right environment to rediscover their best form in ODIs.

French Open: Satwik-Chirag knocked out of men's doubles; Unnati Hooda progresses French Open: Chirag Shetty and Satwiksairaj Rankireddy were knocked out of the Super 750 badminton tournament after losing their round of 32 match to Indonesia's Rahmat Hidayat and Muhammad Rian Ardianto on Wednesday. However, rising star Unnati Hooda kept Indian hopes alive by advancing to the pre-quarter-finals.

New Zealand will wear the underdog badge with pride against India: Sophie Devine New Zealand's Sophie Devine admits that India will come into their upcoming fixture as the favourites. The two sides are set to clash in what will be a virtual quarterfinal clash, with the final ticket to the semis up for grabs.

After Sarfaraz Khan's shock omission, Irfan Pathan urges fans to trust selectors Irfan Pathan appeals to fans to trust the BCCI selectors despite Sarfaraz Khan's exclusion. The debate raises questions on selection transparency and procedural issues.

IND vs NZ, Navi Mumbai weather forecast: Will rain disrupt crucial clash? Women's World Cup: India will look to end their three-match losing streak when they face New Zealand in Navi Mumbai, in a contest threatened by rain, with forecasts predicting "rain or thundershowers" later in the evening or night.

The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) reportedly have majority support but are unlikely to push for the impeachment of Asian Cricket Council (ACC) chief Mohsin Naqvi, aiming to avoid further tensions with Pakistan ahead of India hosting the T20 World Cup in 2026.

One last innings at his beloved Oval could be the statement that confirms the hunger still burns, with the 2027 World Cup the prize he's aiming to conquer.

Dominant Australia extend unbeaten run as Sutherland, Gardner decimate EnglandWomen's World Cup: Ashleigh Gardner smashed a record 69-ball century, while Annabel Sutherland remained unbeaten on 98, as tournament favourites and defending champions Australia crushed England by six wickets in their clash on Wednesday.

Al-Nassr down brave FC Goa 2-1 in thrilling Fatorda showdownFC Goa fought valiantly at Fatorda Stadium but fell short as Al-Nassr secured a hard-fought win. Angelo Gabriel and Haroune Camara scored early for the visitors, while Brison Fernandes pulled one back. Late red card for David Timor ended Goa's comeback hopes.

Ashes: Australia legend says Steve Smith shouldn't captain in Cummins' absenceGreg Chappell said that Australia shouldn't have made Steve Smith the captain for the first Ashes Test against England. Smith will step in to fill for Pat Cummins as the pacer continues to recover from a back injury.

Feel sorry for Sarfaraz: Ashwin slams young batter's exclusion from India A squadFormer India spinner R Ashwin has expressed concern over Sarfaraz Khan's exclusion following the announcement of the India A squads for the red-ball series against South Africa A. Ashwin highlighted Sarfaraz's strong domestic performances and recent fitness improvements.

IND vs NZ Predicted XI: Will India bring back Jemimah Rodrigues?Women's World Cup, IND vs NZ: Jemimah Rodrigues didn't play the match against England, but India can think of bringing her back in the match against the White Ferns in Navi Mumbai.

Devine sees India as favourites despite home pressure in crucial semifinal clashNew Zealand's Sophie Devine sees India as the clear favourites ahead of their clash which is a virtual quarterfinal clash as both sides compete for the last remaining spot for the next stage of the Women's World Cup.

Abhinav Bindra to be a torch-bearer for next 2026 Winter OlympicsOlympic gold medallist Abhinav Bindra was selected as a torch-bearer for next year's Winter Games. The Winter Olympics 2026 will be held from February 6 to February 22 in Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy.

Ashwin highlighted Sarfaraz's strong domestic performances and recent fitness improvements.

Home World Cup brings pressure, but India well-equipped to handle it: MuzumdarIndia coach Amol Muzumdar has backed his side and said they're well-equipped to handle the pressure of playing in a home World Cup ahead of the crucial tie against New Zealand. India need a win to qualify for the semi-finals.

Manchester City fan dies in Spain ahead of Champions League match against VillarrealGuy Bradshaw, a 35-year-old Manchester City supporter, died unexpectedly in Benidorm ahead of the club's Champions League fixture against Villarreal. His death has prompted tributes and significant fundraising to support repatriation and funeral costs.

Zimbabwe end 24-year long wait after crushing Afghanistan in Only TestZIM vs AFG: Zimbabwe crushed Afghanistan by an innings and 73 runs in Harare to seal their first innings victory in 24 years, powered by Ben Curran's century and Richard Ngarava's five-wicket haul.

AUS vs IND 2nd ODI Predicted XIs: Will Kuldeep finally play in Adelaide?India head into the second ODI against Australia in Adelaide with a Kuldeep Yadav conundrum playing on their minds. Will the Indian team management take the punt and allow the spinner to play in the crucial game?

After England snub, gritty Jemimah Rodrigues sweats it out in Navi Mumbai heatWomen's World Cup 2025: Team India toiled hard under the scorching heat of Navi Mumbai ahead of their sixth fixture of the tournament against New Zealand. Captain Harmanpreet Kaur looked focused as ever, while Jemimah Rodrigues left no stone unturned to find her rhythm back.

No pressure on Harmanpreet Kaur, Amol Muzumdar backs India captain to click soonIndia women's team faces a crucial must-win game against New Zealand in the World Cup. Coach Amol Muzumdar expresses full confidence in captain Harmanpreet Kaur's leadership despite recent setbacks.

2nd Test Day 3: Babar Azam keeps Pakistan alive after Rabada's special with batSenuran Muthusamy and Kagiso Rabada both recorded career-best scores with the bat as South Africa mounted a rearguard fight to turn the second Test against Pakistan on its head, seizing the upper hand after an enthralling third day's play on Wednesday.

Defiant India coach Amol Muzumdar brushes aside Pratika's strike-rate criticismIndia coach Amol Muzumdar has brushed aside the criticism around Pratika Rawal's strike-rate ahead of the clash against New Zealand. The Indian opener has been sedate with her approach, especially in the powerplay overs.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
